title: How to Make Mini Box People

steps.headline: Print out rectangular prism and cube box shapes.
steps.description: Print them on blank card or printing paper with nothing patterned or marked. You will need one prism box and one cube box per miniature person being made. You can also draw out your own, though it may take a long time.

steps.headline: Cut out both a rectangular prism and cube.
Fold and glue into the correct box shapes.
steps.description: The glue will keep the folds solidly in place. If you want to, you can skip the second part by drawing on the cut-outs first. Try not to use too much glue or there will be a huge mess!

steps.headline: Let it dry for 30 or so minutes.
steps.description: Drying time is dependent on the glue. Depending on the glue, it may take a whole hour before the glue dries completely.

steps.headline: Glue the cube on top of one of the smaller ends of the rectangular prism.
steps.description: The rectangular prism must face up tall and the cube must be placed on top. Allow to dry completely by waiting 30 or so minutes (maybe a whole hour).

steps.headline: Paint the person.
steps.description: The rectangular prism is the body while the cube is the head. Arms can be painted down the sides, small shoes at the base, if wished. Choose whatever style of clothing you like. If you want to be a bit more complex, you can draw cut-outs of arms and legs that you can glue onto. Make sure to have the coloring on the cut-outs first, though! Add buttons, lace, ribbon or any other three-dimensional decorations, as wished.

steps.headline: Let the paint dry for a day, to be sure it sets firmly.
steps.description: You could also paint one part at a time to prevent paint from dripping.

steps.headline: Play with it!
steps.description: You can also decorate it anywhere you want.

text: Making the boxes Print out rectangular prism and cube box shapes. Print them on blank card or printing paper with nothing patterned or marked. You will need one prism box and one cube box per miniature person being made. You can also draw out your own, though it may take a long time. Cut out both a rectangular prism and cube.  Fold and glue into the correct box shapes. The glue will keep the folds solidly in place. If you want to, you can skip the second part by drawing on the cut-outs first. Try not to use too much glue or there will be a huge mess! Let it dry for 30 or so minutes. Drying time is dependent on the glue. Depending on the glue, it may take a whole hour before the glue dries completely. Making miniature people Glue the cube on top of one of the smaller ends of the rectangular prism. The rectangular prism must face up tall and the cube must be placed on top. Allow to dry completely by waiting 30 or so minutes (maybe a whole hour). Paint the person. The rectangular prism is the body while the cube is the head. Arms can be painted down the sides, small shoes at the base, if wished. Choose whatever style of clothing you like. If you want to be a bit more complex, you can draw cut-outs of arms and legs that you can glue onto. Make sure to have the coloring on the cut-outs first, though! Add buttons, lace, ribbon or any other three-dimensional decorations, as wished. Let the paint dry for a day, to be sure it sets firmly. You could also paint one part at a time to prevent paint from dripping. Finished. Make more as needed. Play with it! You can also decorate it anywhere you want.
